text: <@U017GNJM021> I see. I think its good for people to have strong perspectives like that! Geometric algebra just isn't the right problem then so I see what you are saying. Gotta say I'm a bit relieved you are leaving some cool stuff for the rest of us!

elements.text: I see. I think its good for people to have strong perspectives like that! Geometric algebra just isn't the right problem then so I see what you are saying. Gotta say I'm a bit relieved you are leaving some cool stuff for the rest of us!

text: Ahh actually I will still be using it, just not basing much around it

elements.text: Ahh actually I will still be using it, just not basing much around it

text: <@U017GNJM021>  I wasn’t stressing on mouse driven interaction as much as the need for having the operation available. Something like what the command xp does in Vim on a single line, but that done on multiline is what I intended to achieve with making operations as first class citizen, that is do x (cut) on an operation and then p (paste) on another operation to swap their places. I think that will lead to more exploratory ideas in the system. But since I haven’t interacted with what you have built, there’s a chance that I could be off. But see if what I suggested fits, otherwise its cool. What you have shown so far is amazing. Looking forward to see what you do with it!

elements.text: I wasn’t stressing on mouse driven interaction as much as the need for having the operation available. Something like what the command xp does in Vim on a single line, but that done on multiline is what I intended to achieve with making operations as first class citizen, that is do x (cut) on an operation and then p (paste) on another operation to swap their places. I think that will lead to more exploratory ideas in the system. But since I haven’t interacted with what you have built, there’s a chance that I could be off. But see if what I suggested fits, otherwise its cool. What you have shown so far is amazing. Looking forward to see what you do with it!
